description.narrative: The project will establish a fully functional platform that brings all traditional and non-traditional partners to work together to address the issue of air pollution in the City of Skopje

activity-description.narrative: The project aims to demonstrate a multi-pronged intervention to tackle air pollution in the City of Skopje linked to the residential sector

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative: Annual level of fine particulate matter (e.g. PM2.5 and PM10) in the pilot area Number of households implementing changes (EE in house, heating technologies, waste management) Number of regulatory documents drafted and submitted to the appropriate authorities

comment.narrative: Excessive number of days with high level of fine particulate matter (e.g. PM2.5 and PM10) in the City of Skopje Lack of a comprehensive monitoring system for the pilot area (Lisice) Low share of households benefitting from clean, affordable and sustainable energy access in the pilot area Inadequate legal framework to prevent and mitigate the air pollution Low level of awareness and insufficient capacity for coordinated action
1.1.1 Air pollution monitoring system in place 1.3 On-line and coordination web-based platform developed/ Number of stakeholder meetings convened - 3 4.1.1 Marketing survey carried out.

1.1.1 Three outdoor air quality monitoring stations including a meteorological station and five indoor monitoring devices were purchased. The 3 (three) outdoor monitoring stations were placed in Lisice on three different locations with the aim of measuring the local air pollution coming from individual residential houses. The 5 (five) indoor monitoring devices were temporally installed at the selected households in order to measure the current indoor air quality. The evidence/data provided will be used for activities related to raising public awareness. 1.3 The web-based platform developed. It will provide reliable presentation of the air pollution data, present activities on air pollution in the country, enable discussions about the possible solutions of the air pollution and other relevant issues, create and communicate relevant events, enable pollution reporting and similar. The aim of the platform is to contribute towards: awareness raising, stakeholders coordination and citizen engagement. Meetings with the representatives from the City of Skopje, Municipality of Aerodrom, Ministry of Labour and Social Policies, Swedish Environmental Protection Agency, representatives from World Bank/European Investment Bank were held. The on-going on-line communication is established with different stakeholders including MoEPP, City of Skopje, Ministry of Economy, Municipality of Aerodrom, Municipality of Gjorche Petrov and so on. 4.1.1 Survey related to air pollution issues of three target groups: citizens in Lisice, CSOs and retailers and wholesalers of heating devices was conducted. Prior to finalizing the subject document related to the development of new subsidy models, a co-design workshop was organized on the 25th of November, and it included more than 20 relevant stakeholders: representatives from several Municipalities (Tetovo, Gostivar, Bitola, Aerodrom, Kumanovo, Veles and Kavadarci), representatives from the Civil Sector, individuals, representatives from the MoEPP, Ministry of Finance, Ministry of Economy, Ministry of Labour and Social Policies and representatives from the City of Skopje, among others.
Finalizing the negotiation with SIDA that will lead to approval of the project
Signing of the Cost Sharing Agreement with SIDA

Annual mean levels of fine particulate matter (e.g. PM2.5 and PM10) in cities (population weighted) - 10% decrease Share of households benefitting from clean, affordable and sustainable energy access in Skopje: a) Women-headed, b) Skopje, c) Aerodrom - TBD Volume of investment leveraged from public and private sources through UNDP support for national programmes/initiatives - 1:1 Solutions applied at scale to accelerate transition to improved energy efficiency and clean energy - 3 Decrease of air pollution levels in the selected area (in percentage) - 30% decrease Decrease of polluting emissions from the selected area (in percentage) - 70% decrease 1.1.1 Monitoring and online platform developed 1.2.1 Model developed and report completed 1.3 Number of stakeholder meetings convened - 6 2.1 Number of regulatory documents drafted and submitted to the appropriate authorities - (2+3) 3.2 - Number of households implementing changes (EE in house, heating technologies, waste management, greenery - 100 4.1.1 Marketing survey and co-design of awareness raising activities 4.1.2 Capacity/gap assessments and capacity building programmes - 3 Assessments and 3 Programmes

The annual means level of the fine particulate matter and the decrease of pollution will be calculated during the next project year. The Project has received data/calculations from the energy audit, which will be combined/compared with the data from the monitoring stations, Source Apportionment Study, and others. The results will be analyzed by the University Goce Delcev from Shtip and Chief Technical Advisor and shared. The project collected significant data and created data basis about the households and households’ members, including women-headed households. All these data in the next period will be further analyzed and shared. The project also made calculations and created data basis for each individual household in terms of the ratio of investment (UNDP : Household). In addition to this UNDP and the City of Skopje agreed the construction waste from the energy efficiency interventions in Lisiche to be disposed free of charge at the Public Enterprise Drisla. The project will continue its effort to increase the volume of investment leveraged from public and private sources by its end. 1.1.2 Monitoring and online platform developed - http://cistvozduh.mk/ Prior the development of the Air Pollution web platform content zoom meeting with the representatives from MoEPP and City of Skopje and other interested parties, including the web platform developer. The group agreed on the principles on which the platform will function and scheduled additional meetings with the MoEPP to further define some detail related to visualization of the air pollution indexes. The web platform and its content is managed by the University Goce Delcev - Shtip. 1.1.3 Repeating of the SkopjeSeZagreva 2017 survey – the survey is repeated, and the study is prepared. 1.2.1 Source Apportionment Model developed and report completed - the measurements, analyses and calculations are done. The confirmation of the results will be done by external and independent laboratory. It is expected that the public promotion of the Source Apportionment Study results will be presented in February. 1.3 Number of stakeholder meetings convened (6) - So far, more than 10 meetings with different stakeholders and interested parties were conducted, for which Minutes of the meetings are prepared. 2.1 Number of regulatory documents drafted and submitted to the appropriate authorities - (2+3) In cooperation with the Ministry of economy 15 correspondent table, both EU-MK form and MK-EU form, for the Rulebook on Labelling of Energy-Related Products were developed. The project team during the next project year will focus on other aspect of the legislation improvements, which will be coordinated with MoEPP. 3.2 Number of households implementing changes (EE in house, heating technologies, waste management, greenery (100) - In total 128 houses are implementing energy efficiency changes, which is more than the set target of at least 100 houses. 4.1.2 Capacity/gap assessments and capacity building programmes - 3 Assessments and 3 Programmes: The University of Goce Delchev Stip and Chief technical advisor prepared three programs – For the 1) CSOs, 2) Retailers of energy efficiency and heating devices and 3) Media workers/Journalists and conducted capacity building training sessions for the CSOs and for the Retailers of energy efficiency and heating devices.
